content.title: Basilic Vein Transposition Technique
content.description: Surgical technique for brachiobasilic fistula with vein transposition

key_concepts.details: Basilic vein is deep and not suitable for direct cannulation; transposition brings it superficial
Harvest, transpose, and anastomose in single operation; requires adequate vein
First stage: create fistula deep; Second stage: transpose after arterialization (6-8 weeks)
Similar patency to brachiocephalic fistula; higher complication rate (steal, swelling)

content.statement: Basilic Vein Transposition Technique is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Basilic Vein Transposition Technique helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Basilic Vein Transposition Technique include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Basilic Vein Transposition Technique.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Basilic Vein Transposition Technique. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
